adjectives.description: rigged (comparative more rigged, superlative most rigged)

entries.meaning: (figurative) Pre-arranged and fixed so that the winner or outcome is decided in advance.
examples: There was a vicious rumour that the final was rigged, as the defense seemed useless.

entries.meaning: (nautical, typically not comparable) Having the rigging up.
examples: We were ready to embark upon our journey now the vessel was rigged.

entries.meaning: simple past tense and past participle of rig
